snippet: Pathologists took up the question of what contributed to the death of the Soviet leader Vladimir Ilyich Lenin at the age of 53.
lead_paragraph: BALTIMORE -- The patient founded a totalitarian state known for its ''merciless terror,'' Dr. Victoria Giffi told a rapt audience of doctors and medical students on Friday afternoon. He died suddenly at 6:50 p.m. on Jan. 21, 1924, a few months before his 54th birthday. The cause of death: a massive stroke. The man's cerebral arteries, Dr. Giffi added, were ''so calcified that when tapped with tweezers they sounded like stone.''

headline.main: The Death Of Lenin: Tracking A Suspect
